MSFT &#160; NASDAQ Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter). Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item&#8201;5.02. Departure of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers On December&#160;5, 2025, Microsoft Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221; or &#8220;Microsoft&#8221;) held its 2025 Annual Shareholders Meeting (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;). At the Annual Meeting, the Company&#8217;s shareholders approved the Company&#8217;s 2026 Stock Plan (the &#8220;2026 Stock Plan&#8221;). The 2026 Stock Plan replaces the Microsoft Corporation 2017 Stock Plan in its entirety. The material terms of the 2026 Stock Plan are described in &#8220;Proposal 4: Approval of the Microsoft Corporation 2026 Stock Plan&#8221; in the Company&#8217;s definitive proxy statement on Schedule 14A filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on October&#160;21, 2025, which is incorporated by reference herein. Item&#8201;5.07. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders There were 7,433,087,554 shares of common stock entitled to be voted at the Annual Meeting, of which 6,321,402,487 were voted in person or by proxy. The results for each item submitted for a vote of shareholders are as follows. The shareholders: &#160; (1) Voted to elect each of the 12 nominees for director. &#160; (2) Approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company&#8217;s named executive officers. &#160; (3) Voted to ratify the appointment of Deloitte&#160;&amp; Touche LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2026. &#160; (4) Voted to approve the Microsoft Corporation 2026 Stock Plan. &#160; (5) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a European Security Program Censorship risk audit. &#160; (6) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on risks of censorship in generative artificial intelligence (&#8220;AI&#8221;). &#160; (7) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on AI data usage oversight. &#160; (8) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on data operations in human rights hotspots. &#160; (9) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on human rights due diligence. &#160; (10) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on AI and machine learning tools for oil and gas development and production. The Company&#8217;s inspector of election certified the following vote tabulations: Election of directors &#160; Director &#160;&#160; Vote&#160;Results &#160; &#160;&#160; %&#160;Votes For &#160; &#160;&#160; For &#160; &#160;&#160; Against &#160; &#160;&#160; Abstain &#160; &#160;&#160; Broker Non-Votes &#160; Reid G.
